1 Kings or 3 Kings__06.5__Upon the wall: : i. e. joining to the wall.-- Ibid.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__06.5__He built floors round about: : Chambers or cells adjoining to the temple, for the use of the temple and of the priests, so contrived as to be between the inward and outward wall of the temple, in three stories, one above another.-- Ibid.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__06.5__The oracle: : The inner temple or holy of holies, where God gave his oracles.
1 Kings or 3 Kings__06.7__Made ready: : So the stones for the building of God's eternal temple in the heavenly Jerusalem, (who are the faithful,) must first be hewn and polished here by many trials and sufferings, before they can be admitted to have a place in that celestial structure.
